meanings.definition: To twist or turn in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent1: She tried to detort the lid off the jar but it was too tight.
meanings.sent2: He carefully detorted the wire to straighten it out.
meanings.sent3: In a funny mishap, he accidentally detorted his own shoelaces while trying to tie them.
meanings.sent4: The plot of the movie seemed to detort at every unexpected twist.
meanings.sent5: The magician's hands seemed to detort reality as he performed his tricks.

meanings.definition: To reverse the twisting or turning of something.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic had to detort the bolt to fix the machine.
meanings.sent2: She had to detort the tangled necklace to wear it.
meanings.sent3: He detorted the tangled slinky toy, making it spring back to life.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to detort the suspect's alibi to uncover the truth.
meanings.sent5: The key turned easily after he detorted the lock mechanism.
